intro: Astragalus arpilobus subsp. hauarensis, commonly known as the Huaranensis milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the legume family Fabaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its unique morphology, including its hairy stems and specific leaflet arrangement. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in rocky or alpine habitats. This plant plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to soil stabilization.
